all.name: Maharam Agenda
all.description: Founded in 1902, Maharam evolved from a pushcart business on the Lower East Side into a leading global textile resource for architects and interior designers. Hardcover. 232 pages. Four randomized cover variations.

all.name: Maharam Stories
all.description: Maharam Stories brings together a broad range of revealing and engaging design observations from luminaries such as Murray Moss, Hans Ulrich Obrist, John Pawson, Alice Rawsthorn, Michael Rock, Stefan Sagmeister, and more - packaged in a compelling design. Paperback. 284 pages.

all.name: Irving Harper Works in Paper
all.description: Known for his mid-century creation of the Marshmallow Sofa, Ball Clock, and Herman Miller logo as George Nelson Associates' director of design, Irving Harper made hundreds of rarely seen paper sculptures in his spare time from 1963-2000. Hardcover. 176 pages.

all.name: Hella Jongerius: I Don't Have a Favourite Colour
all.description: Hella Jongerius describes her method of research and application to Vitra products.

all.name: Reproducing Scholten & Baijings
all.description: The first monograph on Dutch design duo Stefan Scholten and Carole Baijings takes an in-depth look at their research-intensive, hands-on, and iterative approach to making as demonstrated across seven case studies including those with 1616/Arita Japan, MINI, Georg Jensen, and Maharam. Hardcover. 348 pages.

all.name: Alexander Girard
all.description: A monograph on seminal designer Alexander Girard and his distinctive career.

all.name: Claudy Jongstra
all.description: This volume explore's Claudy Jonstra's distinctive, sustainable approach and provides an overview on her career.

all.name: The Colors of Sies Marjan
all.description: A colorful, comprehensive volume documenting the short-lived but highly influencial work of Sander Lak's beloved and now cult fashion brand, Sies Marjan.

all.name: Karel Martens: Full Colour
all.description: An intimate and  in-depth photographic documentation of the prolific Dutch graphic design of Karel Martens.

all.name: Studio Job & The Graninger Museum
all.description: The book traces a recent survey at the Groninger Museum in the Netherlands featuring 10 years of work by Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel, including the Bavaria Marquette series and Ruins on the end pages. Hardcover.

all.name: Irma Boom: Colour Based on Nature
all.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Booms previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.

all.name: Jacob Hashimoto: Selected Kite Works & Installations
Ilse Crawford: A Frame for Life

all.name: Gift Wrap Set
all.description: Maharam Gift Wrap is printed with a large-scale grid pattern. The irregularity of the pattern ensures that, when wrapped, no two gifts look the same. Each package contains 4 sheets of two-sided paper, with a total of four color options.

all.name: Sales Integration Announcement Card
all.description: Flat cards designed to be displayed as part of presentations and leave-behinds. The flat card should not be written on or altered in any way.

all.description: Flat cards designed to be displayed as part of presentations and leave-behinds. The flat card should not be written on or altered in any way.

all.name: 20 Years of Paul Smith and Maharam
all.description: This book highlights our studios’ shared commitment to design and long-term exploration of traditional motifs reimagined through color, pattern, and scale.

all.name: The Archetypes
all.description: Set of twelve 15 x 22.75 in posters. Each feature a single character named for Swiss psychoanalyst Carl Jung's twelve archetypes of personality and incorporate Maharam textiles. Printed on newsprint.

all.name: Sonnhild Kestler Poster Set
all.description: A series of poster sets including four original designs and an in-depth process booklet featuring photography by Nick Ballon.

all.name: Notebook Set
